chapter.title: Capture your objectives
chapter.p: To begin capturing your program objectives, click on the backlog link on the Mingle Programs landing page:

This will take you to your backlog where you can start capturing high-level objectives and content about their value and purpose. (Don’t worry about getting your objective names right the first time. You can easily edit their names inline by clicking on them. Read more about tips on naming.)

Once created, objectives can be given a relative value and size by setting their respective sliders. Doing this will automatically generate a calculated ratio slider, which visualizes the relationship between the value and size of your objective to help you prioritize your objectives later on.

You can also begin to articulate your objective’s value statement, capturing high-level notes about its purpose in the text box during the research and discovery phase (or equivalent) of your program management process. (N.B. The value statement text box has a 750 character limit.)

You’ll see guiding questions to help define your objective’s value and the impact it will have on your organization and your customers. Simply click save or outside the objective to return to a collapsed list view of your backlog.
